description: The "synthetic.project_portfolio" table represents a collection of project portfolios, each uniquely identified by the "portfolio_id" primary key. It captures essential details about each portfolio, such as the portfolio name, description, owner identifier ("owner_id"), status ("is_active"), and timestamps for record creation and update. With no relationships to other tables, it appears to function independently as a central repository for project portfolio information within the database.

columns.name: portfolio_id
columns.description: This column uniquely identifies each project portfolio in the table, ensuring that every entry has a distinct numerical identifier.

columns.name: portfolio_name
columns.description: This column likely contains metaphorical or abstract expressions that might label or categorize different projects within a portfolio. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: description
columns.description: This column contains narrative descriptions related to various topics such as political events, educational activities, and organizational operations, written in an abstract and fragmented manner. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: owner_id
columns.description: This column likely represents the identifier for individuals or entities who are responsible for or own specific projects within the portfolio. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: is_active
columns.description: This column indicates whether a project in the portfolio is currently active. Projects default to being active unless specified otherwise.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: The column indicates the date and time when a project entry was created in the project portfolio. It automatically populates with the current timestamp at the time of entry creation.

columns.name: updated_at
columns.description: This column indicates the last time an entry in the project portfolio was updated, capturing the date and time of the most recent modification. The repeating timestamp values suggest a batch update or scheduled process recorded simultaneously for multiple entries.

indexes.index_definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX project_portfolio_pkey ON synthetic.project_portfolio USING btree (portfolio_id)
